required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Chinese Medicine on Early Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Chinese Medicine on Early Pregnant Women

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Meiji Health Science and Technology Co., Ltd.

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Institute of Palnned parenthood research

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Meiji Health Science and Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: From April 2021 to December 2021, 50 pregnant women who received intro fertilization (IVF) will be recuited. Among them, 25 of them would like to take Chinese fetal protection medicine from the fourth week of pregnancy (experimental group), while the remaining 25 will not (control group). Blood and feces will be collected in the early morning of the 6th week after successful transplantation to detect 16S DNA in feces, plasma metabonomics, and whole blood transcriptomics.

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators planned to performed a randomized trial to determine the effects of the Chinese medicine used in pregnant women for fetal protection, including mainly radix polygoni multiflori, Rehmannia glutinosa. Two groups will be recruited, 25 pregnant women by IVF without medicine and 25 with the Chinese medicine. In the fourth week, blood, plasma and fetal are sampling for metabolic and intestinal analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: the fourth week in early pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: plasma metabonomics analysis by GC/LC mass
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the fourth week in early pregnancy

other_outcome.measure: whole blood transcriptomics analysis by RNA sequencing
other_outcome.time_frame: the fourth week in early pregnancy

arm_group.description: Pregnant women who received IVF and not taken Chinesene fetal protection medicine until sampling
Pregnant women who received IVF and have taken Chinesene fetal protection medicine from the fourth week during early pregnancy

intervention.description: A Chinese medicine used in pregnant women for fetal protection, including mainly radix polygoni multiflori, Rehmannia glutinosa.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- recieved IVF
- childbirth without miscarriage
- taking vitamins during pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- miscarrige
- missed sampling in the fourth week of pregnancy
- not appropriate judged by the doctor
